courseDescription:
This course is created by Accounting Intuition and accredited by the Chartered Institute of Management Accountants (CIMA). We believe that the best way to learn is through experience so we have developed a set of groundbreaking visualization models. These lessons use the analogy of water pipes and tanks to explain accounting methods to provide an intuitive understanding of how money moves around a simple, connected system.

The course assumes no prior accounting knowledge and lays out the building blocks of bookkeeping step by step. We employ a series of case studies and simulations to describe revenue, costs, assets, liabilities and equity. We also simulate the running of a small business to break down the ‘fundamental accounting equation’ (or ‘balance sheet equation’) and explain the workings of double-entry bookkeeping, financial statements, managing cashflow, the operating cycle, fixed assets and company funding.

Such models are used by leading universities to help their students understand financial concepts and drive this course. Whether you are completely new to finance or simply want an engaging refresher to update your skills, sign up for this course to develop a lifelong, intuitive understanding of accounting. This course suits aspiring bookkeepers and can help small business owners to take control of their finances.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will start at the very beginning and learn how the accrual principle creates a fundamental difference between revenue and cash receipts. The accrual principle is the reason that accounting requires estimation and judgement rather than just the process of recording transactions.
topics: The Accrual Principle - Pros and Cons

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn the concepts of accounting transactions and balances. You will use the first interactive model to explore the relationship between revenue, the receivables balance and cashflow.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will use another interactive model to explore how the timing difference between incurring costs and paying for them creates a payables balance. You will learn that assets and liabilities are different types of accounting balances and understand how they are created.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will use another interactive model to explore what the profit and loss account is. You will learn about the concept of equity. You will understand why the balance sheet always balances due to double-entry bookkeeping.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This topic introduces the format of the 3 main financial statements: the profit and loss statement, balance sheet and cashflow statement. You will learn what information is contained in each statement and how the different financial statements are connected. You will learn techniques such as simple trend and profitability analysis in order to interpret the financial information.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn about working capital and how to manage cashflow.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn about cash conversion and how money flows through a company by examining the operating cycle.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Learn the simple equation that connects profit and loss, the balance sheet and cashflow and explore how this equation made the global financial crisis possible.
